all_text_timv: Puyana, Rafael. prf The golden age of harpsichord music / Rafael Puyana, harpsichord. New York, N.Y. : Mercury, ℗1995. 1 audio disc (75 min.) : digital ; 4 3/4 in. + 1 pamphlet (16 pages ; 12 cm). performed music prm rdacontent audio s rdamedia audio disc sd rdacarrier Mercury Living Presence Compact disc. Notes by Rafael Puyana in pamphlet. Previously released as SR90304 (tracks 1-16)--and as SR90411 (tracks 17-21). My Lady Carey's dompe / Anonymous (c. 1500) -- Les Buffons / John Bull (1562/3-1628), ms. 23523 British Museum -- The primerose / Martin Peerson (1571/3-1651), Fitzwilliam virginal book -- La volta / William Byrd (1543-1623) -- The fall of the leafe (Fitzwilliam virginal book) / Martin Peerson, (1571/3-1651), Fitzwilliam virginal book -- Pavana dolorosa -- Galiarda dolorosa / Peter Philips (1560/1-1628), Fitzwilliam virginal book (1580) -- The King's hunt / John Bull (1562/3-1628) -- Branle gay / Jean- Baptiste Beśard (c. 1567-after 1617) -- Tombeau de M. de Blancrocher / Louis Couperin (c. 1626-1661) -- Branle de montirande ́/ Antoine Francisque (c. 1575-1605 -- Concerto in D minor, after Alessandro Marcello (1684-1750) / Johann Sebastian Bach (1685-1750 -- Sonata in A major / Freixanet (c. 1730-?) -- Sonata in D major / Mateo Albeńiz (c. 1755-1831) -- Pavane in F-sharp minor / Louis Couperin (c. 1626-1661) -- Le moutier, after Louis Couperin / Jacques Champion de Chambonnier̀es (1601/2-1672) -- Gavotte et doubles / Jean-Phillippe Rameau (1683-1764) -- Passepied / Charles Dieupart (after 1667-c. 1740) -- La pantomime / Francois Couperin le Grand (1668-1733). Rafael Puyana, harpsichord. Tracks 1-16 were recorded in April and May 1962. Tracks 17-21 were recorded in April 1964. All were recorded in Ballroom Studio A of Fine Recording in New York City. Harpsichord music. Harpsichord music. fast (OCoLC)fst00951680 Mercury living presence.
